title: Managing Mission-Driven Organizations
description: Course explores the various organizational structures, funding sources, and outcome accountability requirements for civil society organizations, and examines legal and data-driven evaluation approaches to maximize social and environmental impact. Case studies to be drawn from international development, human rights, environmental sustainability, and American politics; nonprofit service delivery organizations, social enterprises, social impact bonds, issue advocacy groups, and others. Students may not earn credit for GPPS 466 and IRGN 490 with the same title.
